p: Among volatile terpenes, the oxygenated derivatives of sesquiterpenes were detected in the analyzed white fir at the lowest level in both seed (0.21 g/100 g) and cone oils (0.04 g/100 g). This group consisted mainly of τ-cadinol and τ-muurol. However, this terpene group was detected in the A. concolor needle oil at a much higher level, up to 6.4% [ 7, 8, 9, 10]. Higher than in white fir oils, the amount of oxygenated sesquiterpenes has been found previously in the silver fir seed cone oils (up to 1.5%) and Korean fir seed and cone oils (up to 1.6%). Intermedeol and selin-6-en-ol were the main one [ 14, 15, 16, 17].
